subject.name: Communicative English
subject.description: Develops proficiency in English communication for technical and professional contexts. Emphasizes vocabulary, grammar, writing skills, comprehension, and the conventions of formal communication to enhance clarity and confidence in academic and workplace communication.

units.title: Vocabulary Building
topics: Nature of word formation: root word and morpheme

units.title: Basic Writing Skills
topics: Parts of speech and sentence structure
Tenses: present, past, and future forms

units.title: Principles of Appropriate Writing
topics: Defining, describing, classifying, and exemplifying ideas
Writing structure: introduction, body, and conclusion
Use of references, quotations, and illustrations
Qualities of professional writing: clarity, conciseness, completeness, correctness, and courtesy

units.title: Practice of Formal Writing
topics: Formal letters: cover letter and job application
Minutes of meeting, memorandum, and notice
Email etiquette, article writing, and writing for current issues

units.title: Comprehension of Written English
topics: Reading comprehension of prose, poetry, and short stories
Texts for comprehension: ‘Of Studies’ by Francis Bacon, ‘The Sun Rising’ by John Donne, ‘The Last Leaf’ by O. Henry

suggested_books: English Language and Communication Skills for Engineers by Sanjay Kumar and Pushp Lata, Oxford University Press
Communicative English for Technical Students by De. Bijay Bahadur Singh and Dr. Kalpana Sinha, Foundation Publishing House
Communication Skills (As per AICTE Syllabus 2018) by Sanjay Kumar and Pushp Lata, Oxford University Press
A Course in Listening & Speaking by V. Sasi Kumar, P. Dutt, and Geetha Rajeevan, Foundation Books
